info.game_comments:
2012 Teen Tournament semifinal game 3.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: Don't complain, citizen, if you don't exercise this fundamental right guaranteed by the 15th Amendment

(2, 1).clue: The musical "Evita": set in this country

(3, 1).clue: He's the recent Super Bowl MVP seen here

(4, 1).clue: The New York Stock Exchange is open for trading 9:30 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. Monday through this day

(5, 1).clue: It's tough to tighten this in hard times, but getting hit below it... that's just wrong

(6, 1).clue: (Vice President Joe Biden delivers the clue.)  The Chevy Coach dates from around the time this became the world's largest car company; with cars like my favorite, the Corvette... it held that position until 2008, then filed for bankruptcy but now it's back on top

(1, 2).clue: Guys, when you turn 18, you'll have to register for this, for potential enlistment into the armed forces

(3, 2).clue: In 2012 Albert Pujols takes his career .328 average & 445 home runs from this city to Anaheim

(4, 2).clue: Barack Obama was elected to the presidency in this year

(5, 2).clue: Confidentially--keep it under your this--I'm throwing mine "into the ring"

(6, 2).clue: (Vice President Joe Biden delivers the clue.)  The Model T was one of the first major industrial products made on this arrangement of workers doing repetitive work, giving productivity a huge boost

(1, 3).clue: If you lose your passport in Oslo, you can get help in this building at 48 Henrik Ibsens gate

(2, 3).clue: Grover's Corners, New Hampshire from 1901 to 1913: this drama

(3, 3).clue: He says the Weight Watchers thing is an even bigger scam than getting paid to watch sports

(4, 3).clue: Newly elected U.S. senators & congressmen are sworn in on the 3rd of this month

(5, 3).clue: More than a little bit upset? Then you're "hot under" this

(6, 3).clue: (Vice President Joe Biden delivers the clue.)  Before pump prices spiked in the 1970s, buyers didn't care much if the car was this alliterative term referring to its 12 miles per gallon fuel efficiency

(1, 4).clue: Politics calling? This is the minimum age to serve in the U.S. House of Representatives

(2, 4).clue: "Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead": within & around the action of this other play

(3, 4).clue: Tony Stewart won this organization's Sprint Cup in 2011; previous cup wins include the Winston & the Nextel

(4, 4).clue: William the Conqueror & the Normans invaded England in this century

(5, 4).clue: Speaking with no preparation is speaking "off" this

(6, 4).clue: (Vice President Joe Biden delivers the clue.)  The Jeep came to America's notice when soldiers depended on it during WWII... today, it's a popular vehicle from this, one of the big 3 automakers

(1, 5).clue: Often taking years, it's the process by which those born & raised foreign citizens become U.S. citizens

(2, 5).clue: The Kellers' home in Tuscumbia, Alabama: this drama

(3, 5).clue: He takes time out from his work as a Philippine congressman to win a lot of boxing matches

(4, 5).clue: The Brits celebrate Boxing Day on the 26th of this month

(5, 5).clue: Look down at your laces for this word that describes a threadbare budget

(2, 1).clue: 2 dots & a horizontal line make an obelus, which we use to signify this basic math operation

(3, 1).clue: Robert Flaherty's 1922 documentary "Nanook of the North" was about a member of this Arctic people

(5, 1).clue: Yours is endo-; a crab's is exo-; a jellyfish's is hydrostatic, made of fluid

(6, 1).clue: Appearing before Congress in 2010, Halliburton, Transocean & this oil company blamed each other for a giant spill

(2, 2).clue: On Twitter the familiar symbol seen here is called this 7-letter name and helps organize tweets into groups

(4, 2).clue: It's used in web addresses to denote the country just to the north of us

(5, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents the clue.)  In genetics Yy stands for two genes; the capitalized Y is dominant & the lowercase one is this

(6, 2).clue: In 2005 this mayor of Tehran won the presidency of Iran in a landslide over Hashemi Rafsanjani

(2, 3).clue: Draw a square, divide it in 4 with a cross & you've made a Japanese symbol for a field of this grain

(3, 3).clue: Later famous for thrillers like "Psycho", this man directed the silent murder mystery "The Lodger"

(4, 3).clue: A great way to say hello (but not goodbye)

(5, 3).clue: In 2011 virologist Ron Fouchier made bird flu more contagious by introducing these genetic changes--bad idea, some say

(6, 3).clue: In 2003 fighting erupted in this western region of Sudan, with Arab militia committing genocide against non-Arab farmers

(2, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents the clue.)  The U.S. Air Force coat of arms depicts two symbols of airstriking power; a bald eagle & thunderbolts from this Roman god of the sky & heavens

(3, 4).clue: Not only did this mustached comic star in 1925's "The Gold Rush", he wrote & directed it too

(4, 4).clue: This 2-letter abbreviation is placed in front of oz. to denote a liquid measurement

(5, 4).clue: Canavanine, produced by some plants, is a special one of these acids; it messes up proteins in insects' bodies

(6, 4).clue: In February 1997 Scottish scientists announced the birth of this first cloned sheep

(2, 5).clue: Later seen as racist, lawn jockeys may have meant a house was part of this 19th c. network leading to liberty

(4, 5).clue: Mi & this are the 2 USPS abbreviations also found in the musical sol-fa series

(5, 5).clue: Eukaryotes are cells that have defined nuclei; change the prefix & you get these organisms that don't, like bacteria

(6, 5).clue: In October 2000 terrorists attacked the USS Cole when it stopped to refuel at the port of Aden in this country

(0, 0).clue: Seeing young people competing in a reality show on one channel & fighting a war on another gave this author a book idea
